content.question: The rational functions <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> are defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 30 x over denominator x squared plus 10 end fraction"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> and <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 2 x minus 1 over denominator x cubed plus 15 end fraction"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>. If the function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals f open parentheses x close parentheses minus g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>, what are all real zeros of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
